author: Tomi Astikainen
title: Slush Collaboration
description: Lack of exposure in the entrepreneur networks outside crypto economy and blockchain circles.

assessments.note: I think it is a good idea to have a "Cardano stall" on an event like this.  But till December, it might be that cardano will already make a large reputation, thus this is a long run project, and I am not sure if is on schedule.

The end statement of the proposal states "Progress so far: Discussions between the Slush Partnership Manager and the IOG Commercial Director have already been initiated and initial meetings to discuss details have been set." 
A collaboration with Slush might indeed prove to be beneficial, yet it's not clear why there would be a need for a third party intermediary and for funds from Project Catalyst.
assessments.reply: This is mentioned very clearly (perhaps even too succintly?): "I coordinate the collaboration between Slush and IOG and function as boots on the ground." It is very difficult for IOHK to handle everything from distance because they are in US and Slush HQ is in Finland. Therefore the need for "boots on the ground".

assessments.note: Getting the word out to entrepreneur communities would be a great way to increase proposals to Project Catalyst.
This would be a great way to attract proposers from outside the Cardano ecosystem. Addresses the challenge.

Slush has attracted many startups and venture capitalists in the last 10 years of its existence. Carano has a host of possibilities for exploitation by both. Therefore the proposal to include Cardano in Slush 2021 is perfectly matching with the criteria of this fund.
The proposal in really on point with the challenge and the target audience is indeed the one Project Catalyst is looking for. Probably one of the best proposals in this matter.

I agree that one of the biggest ways to outreach is to get bright people to contribute with the environment and no place is better to find this kind of people than start-up/entrepreneur meetings. 

I've just missed some more detailed information about the partnership, how it will actually work. In the "potential value-adding services" topic is mentioned very briefly the improvements, however I wonder how much space will Project Catalyst really have to pass information, newsletter and co-participate in lectures or presentations.
The proposer provided a valid reason why he should be able to pull it off.

The proposer's experience as a business consultant does give some value to his proposal, yet it is still unclear what the entire undertaking is about. Is it just some online sessions with Slush for which USD 24000 are to be paid and to whom? To Slush? On their website they have not included any pricing. Can the proposer provide some extra links?
assessments.reply: Slush collaboration pricing is mentioned in the enclosed PDF and replicated in the proposal in both USD and EUR. It shows the reviewer has not read the proposal thoroughly.

assessments.note: The proposer has the connections to make this work.
No information around the team behind this. No detailed technical experience required, more of a marketing and entrepreneurship required.
assessments.reply: Applications for Slush Team 2021 are still open: https://www.slush.org/team/

assessments.note: The proposal credentials are in the open domain and have sufficient experience for the task involved in ensuring the success of the proposal.
The experience is on point with the proposal and the plan is detailed. The proposer has previous experience with such events and the proposal looks solid.
Beg your pardon but it seems that is not you who has the final word, and if this is the case, it seems a bit odd to fund something that we do not have the control that will actually happen.
assessments.reply: If this is funded, it will happen. It seems that the reviewer has not understood the scope of the proposal (limited to the digital collaboration and community activation). If IOHK prefers to have a larger scope and attend the main event then that can be funded directly from marketing budget.

assessments.note:
a very detailed metrics. 

yet how do we trace what proposals are coming from Slush collaborationproject? The proposer is not sure, or it has not been determined yet.
assessments.reply: This question has been answered and addressed in the Comments section: "that depends how we decide to use Ideascale and other tools in future funds. It could be as simple as a label, its own challenge altogether or just measuring how many users say in their profile that they are an entrepreneur (that choice is already there but I am not all clear what reporting tools Ideascale has on offer)".

assessments.note: The proposal is several hundred words long, yet at the end of it I still wasn't sure what it was exactly about. Would there be 2 online meeting between Slush and the proposer on behalf of IOG, while one of them would be a "mentoring session focused on hands-on advice on building companies". Who needs advice to build a company? IOG? The description should focus first on describing what the event is in clear terms, without too much emphasis on marketing speech.
assessments.reply: Reviewer is criticizing the proposal for lack of details yet those cannot be provided before IOHK and Slush agrees on the partnership details.

assessments.note: It is clear how this would help increase proposals from outside the current Cardano community.

Very well formualted proposal, contains all parts I would need to assess like deliverables, metrics, timeplan and allocation of funds. The only thing missing is some more information about the proposer itself.
assessments.reply: LinkedIn profile is included and that outlines in detail what I'm capable of. Reviewer might not know that there is limited space allocated for each section.

assessments.note: The proposal is clear and straightht forward. The proposal has a clear time and budget plan. The proposal is highly feasible and has the potential to attract a large number of fresh entrepreneurs into the Cardano ecosystem.

The plan is detailed and the budget is partitioned. Milestones and deliverables are defined as well as success metrics. There are also sufficient info to judge what is the impact / purpose of Slush to those that are unfamiliar with it
The only thing missing is some methods to quantify the actual gain (#) of people who are joining the community because of the Slush partnership.
assessments.reply: Referring to the Comments section again: this depends on the possibilities of Ideascale. Easiest is to track the increase of members who say in their profile they are an "Entrepreneur" (doesn't matter whether they come from Slush community or elsewhere as long as they join).

solution: Get access to the entrepreneur and investor network of the biggest startup event of the year, Slush (www.slush.org).
experience: I coordinate the collaboration between Slush and IOG and function as boots on the ground: https://www.linkedin.com/in/tomiastikainen/
